page.title: 13Ecology: Plants
page.content:
White willow and white poplar are the commonest trees and hawthorn, blackthorn, ash, sycamore and elder also occur. Willows are commonly pollarded. The few hedges are mainly hawthorn and bramble.
Grasses, mainly cocksfoot, common couch, false oat, and meadow foxtail form the dominant cover on the non-arable areas.
The lodes contain abundant submerged waterweed, as well as waterlilies, yellow flag, hemp agrimony, meadowsweet, common waterstarwort and brockline. The common reed, great reedmace and sedges grow in all watercourses. The verges are characterised by cow parsley, hemlock, stinging nettles, dock, burdock and great willowherb.
